member.name: T:System.Threading.IOCompletionCallback
member.summary: Receives the error code, number of bytes, and overlapped value type when an I/O operation completes on the thread pool.
member.param: The number of bytes that are transferred.
A representing an unmanaged pointer to the native overlapped value type.

member.name: T:System.Threading.NativeOverlapped
member.summary: Provides an explicit layout that is visible from unmanaged code and that will have the same layout as the Win32 OVERLAPPED structure with additional reserved fields at the end.

member.name: F:System.Threading.NativeOverlapped.EventHandle
member.summary: Specifies the handle to an event set to the signaled state when the operation is complete. The calling process must set this member either to zero or to a valid event handle before calling any overlapped functions.

member.name: F:System.Threading.NativeOverlapped.InternalHigh
member.summary: Specifies the length of the data transferred. Reserved for operating system use.

member.name: F:System.Threading.NativeOverlapped.InternalLow
member.summary: Specifies a system-dependent status. Reserved for operating system use.

member.name: F:System.Threading.NativeOverlapped.OffsetHigh
member.summary: Specifies the high word of the byte offset at which to start the transfer.

member.name: F:System.Threading.NativeOverlapped.OffsetLow
member.summary: Specifies a file position at which to start the transfer.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Overlapped
member.summary: Provides a managed representation of a Win32 OVERLAPPED structure, including methods to transfer information from an instance to a structure.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new, empty instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Overlapped.AsyncResult
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that provides status information on the I/O operation.
member.returns: An object that implements the interface.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.Free(System.Threading.NativeOverlapped*)
member.summary: Frees the unmanaged memory associated with a native overlapped structure allocated by the method.
member.param: A pointer to the structure to be freed.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Overlapped.OffsetHigh
member.summary: Gets or sets the high-order word of the file position at which to start the transfer. The file position is a byte offset from the start of the file.
member.returns: An value representing the high word of the file position.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Overlapped.OffsetLow
member.summary: Gets or sets the low-order word of the file position at which to start the transfer. The file position is a byte offset from the start of the file.
member.returns: An value representing the low word of the file position.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.Pack(System.Threading.IOCompletionCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Packs the current instance into a structure, specifying a delegate that is invoked when the asynchronous I/O operation is complete and a managed object that serves as a buffer.
member.returns: An unmanaged pointer to a structure.
member.param: An delegate that represents the callback method invoked when the asynchronous I/O operation completes.
An object or array of objects representing the input or output buffer for the operation. Each object represents a buffer, for example an array of bytes.
member.exception: The current has already been packed.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.Unpack(System.Threading.NativeOverlapped*)
member.summary: Unpacks the specified unmanaged structure into a managed object.
member.returns: An object containing the information unpacked from the native structure.
member.param: An unmanaged pointer to a structure.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Overlapped.UnsafePack(System.Threading.IOCompletionCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Packs the current instance into a structure, specifying the delegate to invoke when the asynchronous I/O operation is complete and the managed object that serves as a buffer. Does not propagate the calling stack.
member.returns: An unmanaged pointer to a structure.
member.param: An delegate that represents the callback method invoked when the asynchronous I/O operation completes.
An object or array of objects representing the input or output buffer for the operation. Each object represents a buffer, for example an array of bytes.
member.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.
